page.title: 13OIL INDUSTRY EGMANTON
page.content: Industry in the area is limited except for British Petroleum. Drilling in this area started over thirty years ago, and sixty eight wells have been drilled in all. Some were in the village itself, and others were as distant as the next parish. A collecting area was built at Ladywood for the gathering and processing of the oil. From here it is sent to Tuxford rail sidings for transportation to the refinery. Today only four wells are producing oil within our area, and another well is used for water injection and other experimental purposes. The dwindling oil production from the wells indicates that the oilfield is approaching the end of its useful life.
